A classic bolognese sauce is made with ground beef, tomatoes, and herbs, and is typically served with wide, flat pasta noodles, such as pappardelle. A good wine to pair with this dish would be a medium-bodied red wine with moderate tannins and good acidity. Some options include:

* Chianti: A classic red wine from Italy's Tuscany region that pairs well with tomato-based sauces and red meats.
* Montepulciano d'Abruzzo: A medium-bodied red wine from Italy's Abruzzo region with flavors of black cherry and spice.
* Dolcetto d'Alba: A fruity and approachable red wine from Italy's Piedmont region with moderate tannins and good acidity.

These wines will complement the flavors of the bolognese sauce and the pappardelle noodles, and will provide a balanced and satisfying wine and food pairing. You can also ask your wine supplier or a sommelier for recommendations based on your specific menu and wine selection.
